Data on activities is divided into 'corpus' sections. Each corpus contains the master list of activitySets, the collection of activities and the OLAP. The rationale for this level is:
To support developement, so that test data sets can be treated like any other set
To support public access to a corpus for ad-hoc validation
To support staging of activities
To support multiple transformations of the data for example to distinguish between corpuses using different year bases for conversion, or different approaches to project value computation

Initially there will be four corpuses - 3 public and one private. The private corpus vstore is used for casual loading and validation. Files and collections are publicly writeable to support the ad-hoc validation
The corpus descriptor contains the reference for the pipeline for that corpus. Currently vstore has no pipeline defined whilst the others use the only defined pipeline.
